verbose_text: The rapid decline of the anti-MHC class II indirect-pathway CD4 T cell response is therefore surprising but may reflect transient expression of MHC class II on graft parenchymal cells; memory TEa CD4 T cells (XREF_SUPPLEMENTARY), which would be expected to respond to target epitope even when encountered in the absence of costimulatory ligands, proliferated more robustly than naive cells when transferred into C57BL/6 recipients of bm12.Kd.IE heart allografts at the time of transplant but failed to proliferate when transferred at late time points (XREF_FIG D).
